Package controller

Class AppointmentView

java.lang.Object
controller.AppointmentView
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentView extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class controls the application window for the AppointmentView.fxml screen.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The initialize method sets up the screen on launch. It initializes all necessary Observable Lists, sets the items in the table view, and formats the dates and times on the table view into a more readable format. It also collects the user information from the Login controller. LAMBDA: There are four lambdas in this method. Each overrides the updateItem method in the TableCell class so that the date or time is presented in the specified format instead of the default. This enhances the application by setting dates and times in the table in a more readable format.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onCustTableButton

      public void onCustTableButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onCustTableButton method loads the Customer Records screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Customers" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading CustomerRecords.fxml happens.

    • onReportButton

      public void onReportButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onReportButton method loads the Reports screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Reports" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading Reports.fxml happens.

    • onAddAppButton

      public void onAddAppButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onAddAppButton method loads the Add Appointment screen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Add Appointment" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading AddAppointment.fxml happens.

    • onModAppButton

      public void onModAppButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onModAppButton method loads the Modify Appointment screen and passes it the selected appointment from the table view. Error checking is in place to ensure an appointment is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Modify Appointment" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading ModifyAppointment.fxml happens.

    • onDeleteAppButton

      public void onDeleteAppButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      The onDeleteAppButton method confirms that the user wants to delete the selected appointment and removes it from the database upon confirmation. An alert confirms appointment delete. Error checking is in place to ensure an appointment is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Delete" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Signals that an SQLException has occurred in the event an issue occurs when updating the database.

    • onLogOut

      public void onLogOut(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onLogOut method confirms that the user wishes to log out of the program and returns to Login on confirmation.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Log Out" button click on the Appointments View screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading LogIn.fxml happens.

    • onMonthRadio

      public void onMonthRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The onMonthRadio method sets the items in the table view to only the appointments that occur in the same calendar month as the system's current date.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "This Month" radio click on the Appointments View screen.

    • onWeekRadio

      public void onWeekRadio(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The onWeekRadio method sets the items in the table view to only the appointments that occur in the upcoming week based on the system's current date. This view does not show past appointments. In the event that the current day is a Saturday, the next week's appointments will be shown.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "This Week" radio click on the Appointments View screen.

    • onAll

      public void onAll(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The onAll method sets the items in the table view to show all appointments in the database.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "All Appointments" button click on the Appointments View screen.
